metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29976 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers reported memory safety bugs present in code shared between Firefox and Thunderbird. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.12, Firefox ESR < 78.12, and Firefox < 90.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29976` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '90.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
